source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Polygalaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae

leads.lead_text: Plant a slender, often nearly leafless twiner
Flowers distinctly pedicellate; characters otherwise not as above
Flowers sessile; apparently leafless shrub of far north-west with grooved, tuberculate stems
Weak subshrubs to c. 30 cm high, with stems arising annually from a rhizome or persistent rootstock; flowers blue or pinkish
Leafy perennial shrubs mostly higher than 30 cm; flowers pink to mauve (never blue)
Outer 3 sepals all free; flowers blue
Abaxial pair of sepals united for more than half their length; flowers pink or mauve
Plants normally leafy (rarely leafless in some mallee forms); wings c. twice as long as the outer sepals or more; capsules truncate or shallowly 3-toothed at apex; mostly dryish sandy heathland
Plants leafless or with a few scattered leaves toward base; inner sepals (wings) less than twice as long as the outer sepals; capsules rounded, sometimes emarginate at apex; mostly swampy heathland
Leaves with recurved margins, distinctly paler beneath; flowers in typical elongate racemes; mostly lowland heaths
Leaves flat or slightly concave above, concolorous; racemes usually corymbose; mostly wet montane or alpine heaths
